alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Lawrence (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 8:40PM CST until February 08 at 2:00PM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River from Lafayette to Vincennes. .Lowland flooding continues along the Wabash River from Lafayette to Riverton, and will arrive at Vincennes Tuesday night. The crest is currently at Montezuma. Flooding is expected to continue along the lower Wabash at Riverton and Vincennes well into next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 08... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Riverton. * WHEN...Until Thursday, February 08. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Extensive flooding is in progress. Higher rural roads begin to flood. High water isolates many river cabins. Seep water becomes a problem. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EST Monday /8:00 PM CST Monday/ the stage was 17.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM EST Monday /8:00 PM CST Monday/ was 17.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.8 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday, February 08. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Tuesday afternoon by around 1245 PM EST /1145 AM CST/.
